adjectives.description: nosy (comparative nosier or more nosy, superlative nosiest or most nosy)

entries.meaning: Prying, inquisitive or curious in other’s affairs; tending to snoop or meddle.
examples: They built tall fences, yet the nosy neighbors always seemed to know everything about them.

entries.meaning: Having a large or elongated nose.
(UK, slang) A look at something to satisfy one's curiosity.
examples: I might wander down to the construction site for a nosy at what they're building.

verbs.description: nosy (third-person singular simple present nosies, present participle nosying, simple past and past participle nosied)

entries.meaning: (informal, with into) To pry into something.
examples: My brother always nosies into my diary.
